subdisciplines.name: Intaglio
subdisciplines.description: A family of printmaking techniques in which an image is incised into a surface and the incised line or sunken area holds the ink.

subdisciplines.name: Lithography
subdisciplines.description: A method of printing originally based on the immiscibility of oil and water.

subdisciplines.name: Screen Printing
subdisciplines.description: A printing technique whereby a mesh is used to transfer ink onto a substrate, except in areas made impermeable to the ink by a blocking stencil.

subdisciplines.name: Relief
subdisciplines.description: A process where a protruding surface is inked and then pressed into a sheet of paper to create an image.
